page.title: 02DEWSBURY'S SHOPPING CENTRE.
page.content: Much dissatisfaction is being shown about shopping facilities in the town centre.Many properties now display 'To Let' signs, this the result of high rates and declining trade.Takings have been hit too by diversions and delays caused by the start of a two year by- pass scheme.Questions asked of local shoppers in a newly-built shopping precinct reveal disturbing features. Good points did emerge-69% agreed Dewsbury was good for shopping,and 62% said it was better now than it was 10 years ago.But 90% of all shoppers admitted they preferred going to other places, namely Leeds, Wakefield and Huddersfield. Shopping in near-by cities has recently become more attractive because of cheap bus travel during off-peak hours.The trouble with Dewsbury,shoppers said,was the parking problem and too few good shops.
